The base of the pyramid is a square of side length 2, so its area is 4.

The base of the pyramid is a square of side length 2, so its area is 4. The height of the pyramid is the distance from the center of the cube to one of its faces, which is $\frac{2}{2}=1$.
The volume of the pyramid is $\frac{1}{3}(\text{base area})(\text{height})=\frac{1}{3}(4)(1)=\frac{4}{3}$.

The height of the pyramid is the distance from the center of the cube to one face of the cube, which is $\frac{2\sqrt{3}}{2}=\sqrt{3}$.
The height of the pyramid is the distance from the center of the cube to one of its faces, which is $\frac{2\sqrt{3}}{2}=\sqrt{3}$.

The final answer is: $\boxed{\frac{4\sqrt{3}}{3}}$
